3.「え？ なに？ 聞こえないわ。: What? What? I can't hear you.

4.「オレも ついていっていいか！？| って言ったんだよ！: I said, "Can I come with you? I said, "Can I|go with you?

5.「ついていくって……。| あなた <pc>さんと一緒に| 護衛の仕事に行くって言: Are you saying you're going to go with|<pc> to work as an escort?

6.「まもの使いとか 興味ないけどな。| その……護衛とかは なんか興味あるし。: I'm not interested in monster master. But...|I am interested in being an escort.

8.「それでは <pc>さん。すみませんが| ファーベルも 連れていってもらえますか: Okay then <pc>. Excuse me, but could|you take Fabel with you? She won't listen to|me once I start talking about it.

9.「アンタの後ろから 適当に ついていくし。| オレのことは 気にしないで| 目的: I'll just follow along behind you. Don't worry|about me, just go to your destination.

11.「コラッ！ ファーベル！| あなた ちゃんと お礼を言って……: Korra! Fabel! You should have thanked me...

12.「ハァ……。本当に 申し訳ありません。| あの子 礼儀がなってなくて。| 私が: I'm really sorry. That girl has no manners.|It's all my fault...

13.「それでは <pc>さん。| いろいろと よろしくお願いしますね。: Well then <pc>. I look forward to|working with you in various ways.

14.「護衛を待っている人との| 待ち合わせ場所って ここか？: Is this where you're supposed to meet the|people waiting for your escort?

15.「……仲間の魔物さ| アンタに よく なついてるみたいだな。| 後ろで 見させて: My companion, the monster, seems to be very|fond of you. I've been watching from the back.

16.「うわっ！ 相変わらず ひどい道だなあ。| これじゃあ 馬車が壊れちまうよ。: Wow! The road is as bad as ever. I'm going to|break my wagon.

17.「まもの使いってのは あなたのことですね？| 魔物を連れてるから すぐに わかり: By "Monster Master," you mean you, don't you?|I recognized you because you have a monster|with you. I'm Tiltzkin. I'm a peddler.

18.「……って あなたは <pc>さん！！| 覚えてますか あたしのこと！？| ほら: You're <pc>! Do you remember me? You|were lying on the ground, and I carried you to|the village...

19.「いえ……ルーラストーンを ネコババした男| と言ったほうが 思いだせそうですか:
No...I think I would remember him better if I|called him the man who catfished Zoomstone.|Whatever the case may be, I remember him from|
|my past....

20.「しばらく見ない間に ご立派になられましたね。| あたしもね あれから 心を入れ:
You've become a great man in the time I|haven't seen you for a while. I, too, have|changed my mind since then and have been|
|devoting myself to my business. It's true.

21.「今は ある名士の方の お抱え商人として| 雇ってもらってましてね。今回 あなた: I'm currently employed as a merchant for a|prominent person. He is the one who made the|request to you this time.

22.「……と言っても 今は ある名士の方に| 雇われている身でしてね。今回 あなた方: However, I am currently employed by a|prominent person. He is the one who made the|request to you this time.

23.「さてと…… それでは| 今回の依頼について 説明しましょう。: Alright then, let me explain this request.

24.「そちらには 護衛の仕事とだけ| 話が いってるかもしれませんが 実際には| 道:
You may have been told that you are only|supposed to provide escort services, but in|reality, we would like to ask you to perform a|
|cleaning service along the way.

25.「あたし この辺で 採取をしたいんですがね| なんでも ここには トガスのぬしと: I'd like to do some gathering around here, but|I hear there's a vicious monster called Togas|Dogus lurking around here...

26.「そこで あなたに トガスのぬしを倒してもらい| あたしが 気持ちよ～く| 採取: So, I would like you to defeat Togas Dogus so|that I can concentrate on my work.

27.「トガスのぬしは このトガス岩道の西| トガの広場という所を 根城にしてるようで: The Togas Dogus seem to have a stronghold at a|place called West Toga Square on Togas Rock|Road. Get ready and go there.

28.「あたしは 身を潜めながら| まもの使いの実力を 見せてもらいますので| 仲間の: I'm going to hide out and let you show me what|you can do as a Monster Master, so be sure to|take your fellow monster with you.

29.「あれが トガスのぬしってヤツか。: So that's what they call the "Togus no Nushi.

30.「へへっ。それじゃ <cs_pchero>さん。| アンタと仲間の魔物が どんだ: Hehe. Well then, <cs_pchero>. Let's see how|strong you and your companion monsters are.

32.「おお！ トガスのぬしを倒しましたか！: Oh! You have defeated Togas Dogus!

33.「いやはや <cs_pchero>さん。| プクレット村にいた頃とは 見違えまし: Oh no <cs_pchero>. You look different now|than you did when you were in Pukulet village.

34.「きっと たくさんの出会いと別れを経験し| あなたは 強くなっていったのでしょう: I am sure you must have experienced many|encounters and partings, and you have grown|stronger. I am deeply moved...deeply moved.

35.「後ろから こっそり見ていましたが| トガスのぬしが あんな化け物だったなんて|: I was watching from behind and was surprised|to see that Togas Dogus was such a monster.

36.「いや しかし ウワサにたがわぬ その強さ。| あの凶暴な魔物を ひるまず 倒し:
No, but he is as strong as the rumors say. It|is truly amazing that Monster Master can|defeat such a ferocious monster without|
|flinching.

37.「あたしの雇い主……シガール様にも| 今回の活躍ぶりを 報告しておきますよ。|: I will report your success to my employer, Mr.|Sigal. I'm sure he will be very pleased.

38.「おっと…… そろそろ 仕事に戻らないと。| それでは あたしは行きますね。|: Oops... I should get back to work. Well then,|I'll be going. See you again sometime|<cs_pchero>.

39.「おっと…… そろそろ 仕事に戻らないと。| それでは あたしは行きますね。|: Oops... I should get back to work. Well then,|I'll be going. I'll see you again someday,|Monster Master.

41.「アンタは どうして| まもの使いなんてやってるんだ？| 魔物を信じるって 怖く: Why are you a monster master? Aren't you|afraid to believe in monsters?<yesno><close>

42.「オレも……昔は まもの使いの修業をしてた。| でも 急に 仲間の魔物が| オレ: I used to train to be a Monster Master. But|suddenly, my companion monsters stopped|listening to me...

43.「一緒にいた人を 傷つけちまったんだ。: I hurt someone I was with.

44.「もう あんな悲しい思いはしたくないから| 魔物にも……まもの使いにも| 関わら: I don't want to go through that sadness|anymore, so I've decided not to get involved|with monsters...or Monster Masters.

46.「そうですか……。一緒にいた人を| 自分の仲間の魔物が 傷つけてしまった……。|: I see... the person you were with was hurt by|your own companion monster... that's what she|said.

47.「じつは…… ファーベルの言う| 一緒にいた人というのは あの子の父親のことで|: Actually... the person Fabel's Father was with|is the boy's father, and the companion monster|was Fry.

48.「……ファーベルが 私のお腹にいる時でした。| 夫が 母親を失った魔物のタマゴを: It was when Fabel was in my belly. My husband|brought home one of the eggs of a motherless|monster.

49.「そして ファーベルが産まれると ほぼ同時に| そのタマゴからも 一匹のドラゴン: And at about the same time that Fabel was|born, a dragon was born from that egg. That|was Fry.

50.「キッズとファーベルは 兄弟のように仲がよく| あの子が成長して まもの使いにな: Fry and Fabel were like siblings, and even|after the boy grew up and became a Monster|Master, the two remained in perfect harmony.

51.「ですが そんな矢先に 事件が起きたのです。| こちらに越してきて 夫と ファー: But then something happened. When I first|moved here, my husband, Fabel and Fry went to|train...

53.「ファーベルをかばうために| あの子の前に 立ちふさがった 夫は| その時 深手: The husband, who had stood in front of the|child to Cover for Fabel, was deeply wounded|at the time.

54.「夫は 負傷しながらも| 暴れるキッズを 当て身で気絶させ| なんとか その場を: My husband, though wounded, managed to stun|the rampaging Fry with a hit to the head.

55.「なぜか あの人は キズの手当てもしないまま| ファーベルに 家に戻るよう告げる: For some reason, the man told Fabel to go back|to his house and left without treating the|wound.

56.「それから 夫の帰らぬ日々が続き| ついに あの人は 遺体で発見されました……。: Then, after many days of no return, he was|finally found dead...

57.「ファーベルは 自分の未熟さから| 父親の死を招いたのだと 自らを責め それ以来: Fabel blamed himself for his father's death on|his own immaturity, and has since closed the|door on becoming a Monster Master.

58.「あんなに 仲のよかったキッズが| あの子を襲ったなんて 信じたくありませんが|: I don't want to believe that Fry, who I was so|close to, attacked that girl, but everyone|makes mistakes.

59.「クヨクヨせずに あの人と同じ| まもの使いになってほしいと 私は| 今でも 思: I still hope that I can become a Monster|Master just like him without worrying about|it...

60.「いけない！ すっかり 話し込んじゃいました。| ごめんなさい <pc>さんって: I shouldn't! I'm sorry, I've been talking too|much. I'm sorry. I don't know why|<pc> is so easy to talk to...

61.「あなたの優しさに 甘えちゃって……。| いけませんね こんなことじゃ。: I've been spoiled by your kindness... It's not|right, this kind of thing.

62.「それじゃ 暗い話は ここまでにして| 今は この勢いのまま まもの使いのよさを: So, let's put the gloomy talk to rest and just|keep up the momentum and spread the goodness|of the Monster Master!

63.「というわけで <pc>さん。| ウデをみがいて 時が来たら| また チカラを貸: So, <pc>. I hope you'll brush up on|your skills, and when the time comes, lend me|your help again!
